      • AppModel

        public AppModel()
        Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • store

        public void store(Point p,
                  double nRadius)
        Stores the committed point in an ArrayList considered to be the PointSet. If the point is relevant, it will additionally be stored in a second ArrayList considered to be the relevantPoints
        Parameters:
        p - an object of type Point
        nRadius - radius of the quarter circle shown in the painting.

      • getInfo

        public java.lang.String getInfo(Point p)
        Returns a one line string which is tab separated including the most important information about one Point.
        Parameters:
        p - an object of type Point
        Returns:
        tab separated string with point describing information in it

      • writeToPointBook

        public void writeToPointBook(java.lang.String c)
        Appends a string to the text file stored in «current project path + "\PointBook\Points.txt"».
        Parameters:
        c - a string, ideally ending with a line break (CRLF)

      • getCurrentPi

        public java.lang.Double getCurrentPi()
        Calculates Pi and returns it as an Double object. Calculation depends on whether CheatMode is on or not. If CheatMode is on, Pi gets approximated according to an unbound mathematical approach, accessible in the Cheater class. If CheatMode is off, Pi gets approximated according to current ratio between relevant points and number of total points. Points which are within the quarter circle are considered as relevant.
        Returns:
        approximated Pi as an Double object

      • adjustCoordinate_X

        public void adjustCoordinate_X(double nRatio)
        adjusts the x-coordinate of all Points existing according to the ratio of the alteration of the stage's window width.
        Parameters:
        nRatio - a double describing the relative alteration (ratio) of the stage's window width (eg. 1.15 when enlarging the window horizontally by 15%)

      • adjustCoordinate_Y

        public void adjustCoordinate_Y(double nRatio)
        adjusts the y-coordinate of all Points existing according to the ratio of the alteration of the stage's window height.
        Parameters:
        nRatio - a double describing the relative alteration (ratio) of the stage's window height (eg. 0.98 when reducing the window vertically by 2%)

      • reassessRelevance

        public void reassessRelevance(double nRadius)
        After the window was resized and all points have been replaced in the painting, their relevance of being inside the quarter circle or not has to be reassessed. Hence, this method will loop through all the points existing and reassess their relevance individually since this is crucial for the Pi-calculation.
        Parameters:
        nRadius - radius of the quarter circle shown in the painting.
